text: Annefleur Kalvenhaar (10 June 1994 - 23 August 2014) was a Dutch cyclist and mountain biker. She won the European Cyclo-cross Championships in 2013. She began her career at the age of 13. She participated for the first time in a World Cup in 2012. In Houffalize and La Bresse she finished second place in the top 10. She was born in Wierden, Netherlands. Kalvenhaar died in Grenoble, France due to an accident during a XCE race in Meribel, France, aged 20.Renster Kalvenhaar (20) overleden NOS.nl, 23 August 2014 ==References== Category:1994 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Accidental deaths in France Category:Deaths in sport Category:Dutch cyclists Category:Road accident deaths Category:Sportspeople from Overijssel
title: Annefleur Kalvenhaar
